meanings.definition: To pass or go through again
meanings.sent1: She repassed the same street to find her lost key.
meanings.sent2: The hiker repassed the trail to take more photos.
meanings.sent3: He repassed the math problem to make sure he got it right.
meanings.sent4: The melody repassed through her mind, bringing back memories.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to repass the quiz for better understanding.

meanings.definition: To pass or go by again
meanings.sent1: The bus repassed the bus stop after realizing a passenger was left behind.
meanings.sent2: The runner repassed the finish line to help a fellow competitor.
meanings.sent3: The cat repassed the mouse, pretending not to notice it.
meanings.sent4: The car repassed the accident scene, causing a traffic jam.
meanings.sent5: The boat repassed the island, revealing a hidden cove.

meanings.definition: To pass or go over again
meanings.sent1: He repassed his notes before the exam to refresh his memory.
meanings.sent2: The detective repassed the crime scene for any missed clues.
meanings.sent3: The chef repassed the recipe to ensure he didn't miss any steps.
meanings.sent4: The author repassed the manuscript, making final edits.
meanings.sent5: The coach repassed the game plan with the team for the upcoming match.
